message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with a problem of placing broadcast towers in a polygon to localize a point, which is a problem in computational geometry. Therefore, cs.CG (Computational Geometry) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the computational complexity of the problem, which suggests that it could belong to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The reduction from Boolean Three Satisfiability problem to the AGL problem indicates that it could also belong to cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). Finally, the use of Euclidean distance and coordinates suggests that it could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
